intro: Haplopappus watsonii, commonly known as the Watson's pappus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. Haplopappus watsonii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and desert scrub.
